required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Technology Revisiting Ultrasound Solutions of Tomorrow - Artificial Intelligence for Improved Echocardiography

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the effect of artificial intelligence algorithms on image quality in echocardiography.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study population will be recruited from appointed patients at the Clinic of Cardiology, St. Olavs Hospital. After being informed about the study, all patients giving informed consent and meeting the eligibility requirements will undergo their standard clinical echocardiographic exam performed by a sonographer at the clinic. Two additional examinations will then be performed by a different sonographer and an expert cardiologist, respectively.
In one of the study arms the sonographer randomized to perform the second exam will use the AI algorithm (intervention).

primary_outcome.description: Apical foreshortening will be evaluated in a blinded manner by echocardiograhy experts post hoc. The two study arms will be compared.

other_outcome.description: Image quality will be evaluated in a blinded manner by echocardiograhy experts post hoc. A standardized scoring system for image quality in echocardiography developed locally will be utilized for evaluation with score 1-6, where 1 is minimum and 6 is maximum score. The two study arms will be compared.

other_outcome.measure: Inter-observer variation of left ventricular size
other_outcome.description: Throughout this study, the sonographers and expert cardiologist will perform measurements based on their individual echocardiographic images. Differences in measurements will be evaluated to determine inter-observer variation between sonographers and cardiologists.

other_outcome.measure: Inter-observer variation of left ventricular function
other_outcome.description: Throughout this study, the sonographers and expert cardiologist will perform measurements based on their individual echocardiographic images. Differences in measurements will be evaluated to determine inter-observer variation between sonographers and cardiologists.

other_outcome.measure: Validation of AI algorithm to detect foreshortening
other_outcome.description: Comparison of AI algorithm to detect foreshortening with manual reference

other_outcome.measure: Inter-observer variation of left atrial size
other_outcome.description: Throughout this study, the sonographers and expert cardiologist will perform measurements based on their individual echocardiographic images. Differences in measurements will be evaluated to determine inter-observer variation between sonographers and cardiologists.

other_outcome.measure: Inter-observer variation of left atrial function
other_outcome.description: Throughout this study, the sonographers and expert cardiologist will perform measurements based on their individual echocardiographic images. Differences in measurements will be evaluated to determine inter-observer variation between sonographers and cardiologists.

other_outcome.measure: Development of AI algorithm for real-time assessment of left atrium
other_outcome.description: Cardiac structures as left atrial (LA) lumen, LA wall, LA appendix, mitral valve will be annotated and used as reference.
Variation in measurement by the mode of measurement

arm_group.description: In the "With AI algorithm" arm, the sonographer will perform the echocardiographic exam using the AI algorithm.
In the "Without AI algorithm", the echocardiographic exam will be performed without the use of the AI algorithm.

intervention.intervention_name: AI algorithm for apical foreshortening in echocardiography
intervention.description: The algorithm is based on artificial intelligence, giving the sonographer performing the echocardiographic exam real-time feedback on left ventricular apical foreshortening.The algorithm is developed using deep learning techniques by technologists at the Department of Circulation and Medical Imaging, NTNU.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Capacity to consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Indication for echocardiographic contrast agents

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Norwegian University of Science and Technology
